class.name: Word.DropDownListContentControl
class.description: The data specific to content controls of type DropDownList.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a dropdown list content control to verify the connection to the Office host application before performing operations.

properties.name: listItems
properties.description: Gets the collection of list items in the dropdown list content control.

examples.description: Delete a specified list item from the first dropdown list content control in the current selection or its parent content control.

methods.name: addListItem
methods.description: Adds a new list item to this dropdown list content control and returns a Word.ContentControlListItem object.

params.name: displayText
params.description: Display text of the list item.

params.name: index
params.description: Index location of the new item in the list. If an item exists at the position specified, the existing item is pushed down in the list. If omitted, the new item is added to the end of the list.

examples.description: Add a new list item with user-provided text to the first dropdown list content control found in the current selection or its parent content control.

methods.name: deleteAllListItems
methods.description: Deletes all list items in this dropdown list content control.

examples.description: Remove all list items from the first dropdown list content control found in the current selection or its parent content control.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the title property of the first dropdown list content control in the document

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.DropDownListContentControl object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.DropDownListContentControlData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Serialize a dropdown list content control to JSON format to log or store its properties and list items.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a dropdown list content control across multiple sync calls to safely modify its properties without getting an "InvalidObjectPath" error

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Release memory for a tracked dropdown list content control after modifying its properties to prevent memory leaks in the host application.
